volcano.name: Volcano Plot
volcano.description: Visualize differential expression results (e.g., RNA-Seq, proteomics). Highlights significant changes based on fold change and p-value.

data_requirements.description: Requires columns: 'log2fc' (Log2 Fold Change), 'p_value' (Statistical significance), and 'gene_name' (Identifier).

params.label: Highlight Genes (comma-separated)
params.help: Enter gene names exactly as they appear in 'gene_name' column.

heatmap.name: Heatmap
heatmap.description: Visualize expression patterns or other matrix data across samples or conditions. Often includes clustering.

data_requirements.description: Requires a matrix format: Rows typically represent features (e.g., genes), columns represent samples. The first column should contain feature names/IDs. All other columns must be numeric.

params.label: Cluster Rows
params.help: Group rows with similar patterns together.

params.label: Cluster Columns
params.help: Group columns with similar patterns together.

params.label: Standardize Rows (Z-score)
params.help: Scale each row to have mean 0 and std dev 1.

pca.name: PCA Plot
pca.description: Perform Principal Component Analysis (PCA) for dimensionality reduction and visualizing sample relationships based on variance.

data_requirements.description: Requires numeric data columns for analysis. Non-numeric columns (like sample IDs or group labels) can be used for coloring but are ignored during PCA calculation. Ensure samples are rows and features are columns, OR specify transposition.

params.label: Data Orientation: Samples are Columns (Transpose)
params.help: Check this if your input data has Samples as columns and Features/Genes as rows.

params.label: ID/Label Column (for coloring/hover, non-numeric)
params.help: Specify the column name containing sample IDs or group labels (will be excluded from PCA).

params.label: Scale Data (StandardScaler)
params.help: Recommended for PCA. Scales features to unit variance.

params.label: Color Points By ID Column
params.help: Color points using the specified ID/Label column.
